item.title: Christmas in Ukraine Approaches With Power Grid in Crisis
item.description: Moscow has launched far more drones and missiles than in previous years, leaving energy supplies at a tipping point.
item.dc:creator: Nikita Nikolaienko

item.title: The U.S. Offered Putin’s Closest Ally Sanctions Relief—and a Weight-Loss Drug
item.description: Engaging one of the world’s most repressive regimes, Trump envoy bonded with Belarusian dictator over Zepbound and obtained the release of hundreds of prisoners.
item.dc:creator: Meridith McGraw

item.title: Senior Libyan Military Leaders Die in Plane Crash
item.description: An army chief and commander of ground forces for the government in Tripoli were among five confirmed killed shortly after takeoff in Turkey.
item.dc:creator: Elvan Kivilcim

item.title: Political Paralysis Is the New Normal in France—and the Far Right Is Benefiting
item.description: Lawmakers approved a bill averting a government shutdown after weeks of debate in Parliament failed to reach agreement on a new budget.
item.dc:creator: Noemie Bisserbe

item.title: Opinion | Trump Isn’t That Serious About Defeating Xi
item.description: The NSS might talk a good game, but the administration has scored own goals on TikTok and Nvidia chips.

item.title: Opinion | The Hong Kong Speech Police
item.description: The Chinese Foreign Ministry’s spokesman slips up.

item.title: The Biker and Social Media Star Who Police Say Robbed the Louvre
item.description: A man who had once been known for performing stunts around Paris on his motorbike is suspected of being one of four who robbed the museum.
item.dc:creator: Noemie Bisserbe

item.title: Israel Won’t Leave Gaza, Will Build Settlements, Defense Minister Says
item.description: Israel Katz’s statements are at odds with President Trump’s multiphase peace plan for the enclave.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: A Look Back at Those Who Died in 2025
item.description: From Pope Francis to Rob Reiner, a glance at some notable deaths this year.
item.dc:creator: Darcy Eveleigh

item.title: Captive Scam Workers in Cambodia Couldn’t Flee as Bombs Fell
item.description: Laborers being held against their will to run online scams were forced to keep working even as Thai military attacks on a disputed border area intensified.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: Durable-Goods Orders Swung to a Decline in October
item.description: Demand for U.S. durable goods fell in October, following two consecutive monthly increases, according to delayed data published by the Commerce Department.
item.dc:creator: Connor Hart

item.title: Why Japan’s Stock Market Can Keep Rising
item.description: Interest rates are rising, but concerns over the country’s debt are exaggerated.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Back

item.title: Italy Competition Authority Fines Ryanair Over Travel Agencies’ Bookings
item.description: AGCM said the airline abused its dominant position by hindering travel agencies’ sales and the ability of online players to attract internet traffic.
item.dc:creator: Adrià Calatayud

item.title: How a String of Hacks Embarrassed Cyber Powerhouse Israel
item.description: Groups linked to Iran have used relatively simple techniques to leak internal emails and documents, experts say.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: U.S. Targeting Oil Tankers in Bid to Stymie Global Black Market
item.description: Trump administration is aiming to interrupt a shadow fleet of tankers that supply sanctioned oil to several U.S. adversaries.
item.dc:creator: Costas Paris

item.title: Trump Appointment of Greenland Envoy Draws Angry Response From Denmark
item.description: Denmark said it wasn’t told of the appointment, adding to a sense in the country that it is being kept in the dark about Washington’s ambitions.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: China’s Sprint for Tech Dominance Can’t Hide an Economy Full of Holes
item.description: A self-sufficiency push has made China a tougher competitor to the U.S., but it comes with enormous waste.
item.dc:creator: Brian Spegele

item.title: A Russian Billionaire Fights Global Infertility—With 100 of His Own Children
item.description: Telegram founder Pavel Durov will cover IVF costs for women who want to use his donated sperm, and has promised his offspring a share of his fortune.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Venezuela Is Relying on 20 Aging Planes After U.S. Restricted Its Airspace
item.description: The campaign to topple President Nicolás Maduro is stranding Venezuelans around the world, compounding the misery of a beleaguered population.
item.dc:creator: Kejal Vyas

item.title: Jurors Deadlock in Trial of Linda Sun, Accused of Acting as China Agent
item.description: A mistrial was declared on charges against the former New York state aide and her husband.
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: Opinion | China Stalks a Hong Kong Dissident Abroad
item.description: First came a bounty. Next came false sexually explicit letters about the U.K. resident.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Why the Communists Can’t Stand Jimmy Lai
item.description: His primary ‘offense’ was having Western friends, running Apple Daily and being resolved to ‘fight’ for values inimical to Beijing, writes Mark Simon.

item.title: Opinion | An Overdue Distinction for a Korean War Flying Ace
item.description: The legendary fighter pilot, now 100 years old, kept silent for decades about his dogfight with the Soviets during the Korean War.
item.dc:creator: Kate B. Odell

item.title: Canada Picks Former Pension Boss, BlackRock Executive As Top Diplomat in Washington
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney announced that Mark Wiseman would be Canada’s new U.S. ambassador, effective Feb. 15.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Russian General Killed by Car Bomb in Moscow
item.description: Moscow said Ukraine might be responsible for the killing of the head of the General Staff’s army operational training directorate.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: China to Impose Provisional Anti-Subsidy Duties on EU Dairy Products
item.description: According to a preliminary ruling, most EU companies will face rates below 30%.

item.title: Bondi Beach Terror Suspects Condemned ‘Zionists’ and Amassed an Arsenal
item.description: Court documents reveal what police say were the movements and motivation of Sajid and Naveed Akram.
item.dc:creator: Jon Emont

item.title: China Vanke’s Brewing Crisis Suggests Limited Property Easing to Come
item.description: Many of China’s other large developers have already defaulted, and a Vanke collapse would raise questions about how policymakers plan to address the real-estate slump as it drags on into a sixth year in 2026.

item.title: Returning Russian POWs Pay Heavy Price for Choosing Surrender Over Death
item.description: The joy of homecoming is short-lived for returning prisoners, as they face insults, cut pay and orders to return to the front line.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: How China Built an Arms Industry to Rival the West
item.description: Beijing’s ability to churn out advanced armaments is a key element in Xi Jinping’s vision of making his country less reliant on the outside world.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: U.S. Coast Guard Chasing Another Tanker Involved in Shipping Venezuela Oil
item.description: The operation comes as the administration carries out Trump’s order to blockade Venezuela’s oil shipments.
item.dc:creator: Shelby Holliday

item.title: Opinion | The EU Fights Carbon and Loses
item.description: The bloc considers establishing a subsidy to offset a tariff meant to offset a tax.
item.dc:creator: Carlo Stagnaro

item.title: Canada’s $1 Billion Question: Do Property Rights Still Exist in British Columbia?
item.description: A provincial court said indigenous groups can reclaim ownership of land taken from them scores of years ago.
item.dc:creator: Vipal Monga

item.title: U.S. Oil Blockade of Venezuela Pushes Cuba Toward Collapse
item.description: Cuba’s economy, dependent on cheap Venezuelan oil for decades, now struggles to function as a result of the U.S. military’s buildup in the Caribbean and the sharp drop in oil shipments from Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Dubé

item.title: Trump’s Evangelist in Israel Won’t Let MAGA Rift Divert Him
item.description: Ambassador Mike Huckabee sits on the fault line as the president’s coalition splits over support for the Jewish state.
item.dc:creator: Omar Abdel-Baqui

item.title: U.S. Seizes Second Oil Tanker Near Venezuela
item.description: The move ramps up pressure on Caracas after Trump declared a blockade on sanctioned ships moving its oil.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: 14-Hour Shifts and $1 a Delivery—but China’s Army of Gig Workers Keeps Growing
item.description: In a country once known for its factory workforce, some 200 million people are turning to informal roles as job creation slows.
item.dc:creator: Yoko Kubota

item.title: Strikes on Islamic State Pound a Foe the U.S. Once Thought Defeated
item.description: The militant group’s ability to mount and inspire small scale attacks show the difficulty of stamping it out.
item.dc:creator: Omar Abdel-Baqui

item.title: In Germany, Everyone Is a Defense Manufacturer Now
item.description: Facing high costs and falling demand, German manufacturers are reinventing themselves to tap in to the country’s accelerated rearmament.
item.dc:creator: Tom Fairless

item.title: U.S. Pitches ‘Project Sunrise’ Plan to Turn Gaza Into High-Tech Metropolis
item.description: The Jared Kushner and Steve Witkoff drafted blueprint could see the U.S. commit to roughly 20% of some reconstruction costs over 10 years.
item.dc:creator: Peter Grant

item.title: How Putin Got His Preferred U.S. Envoy: Come Alone, No CIA
item.description: The Kremlin fueled the rise of Trump’s friend Steve Witkoff with a prisoner release, sidelining career diplomats.
item.dc:creator: Audrey Valbuena

item.title: U.S. Strikes Syria Targets in Response to Fatal Attack on Americans
item.description: Officials said that dozens of sites were struck after three Americans died in an ambush last weekend that has been blamed on ISIS.
item.dc:creator: Jared Malsin

item.title: Five Potential Obstacles to Peace Between Russia and Ukraine
item.description: A guide to some of the thorny issues as the U.S. pursues a deal to end the war.

item.title: Shein Averts Ban in France Over Childlike Sex Dolls, Weapons
item.description: A Paris court said that a complete shutdown of the e-commerce giant’s platform would be a disproportionate measure.
item.dc:creator: Mauro Orru

item.title: Putin Rallies Support for War in Ukraine During Annual Call-In
item.description: The tightly-choreographed back and forth between the Russian president and average citizens comes as talks continue on finding a path to end the conflict.

item.title: U.K. Government Borrowing Fell, But Challenges Ahead
item.description: The narrower November deficit was largely due to an increase in revenues following the government’s decision to increase a tax on employment.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Trump Tackles Concerns Over Taiwan Strategy With Massive Weapons Deal
item.description: The $11.1 billion sale came after a string of episodes that stirred disquiet about the U.S. president’s appetite to face down China.
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: Arrest of U.S. Employees Processing Asylum Claims for White South Africans Sparks Row
item.description: South Africa said the arrests of seven Kenyan nationals working at an American refugee-processing center were part of an operation aimed at curbing illegal immigration and visa abuse.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: The $8 Billion Black Market for Venezuelan Oil Is Suddenly Closing Down
item.description: About 70% of the country’s oil exports rely on a fleet of sanctioned vessels now being targeted by the U.S. military.
item.dc:creator: Shelby Holliday

item.title: Putin Warns He Will Achieve Aims in Ukraine Through Negotiation or War
item.description: The Kremlin leader called European leaders backing Ukraine “piglets” who wanted to feed on Russia’s collapse.

item.title: Bondi Beach Shooting Suspect Charged With Terrorism, Murder
item.description: Police charged 24-year-old Naveed Akram after he woke up from a coma.

item.title: U.K. Inflation Slows to Eight-Month Low as BOE Prepares Rate Decision
item.description: Prices cooled more than expected in November, keeping the Bank of England on course for a fourth interest-rate cut of the year.
item.dc:creator: Ed Frankl

item.title: Bondi Beach Attack Badly Shakes Sense of Safety for Australia’s Jews
item.description: There has been frustration among Sydney’s Jewish community that authorities haven’t heeded warnings about a rise in antisemitism.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: Father and Son Used Licensed Firearms in Sydney Terror Attack, Police Say
item.description: The Australian prime minister said the suspects acted alone, as he called for tighter gun controls after the deadly Hanukkah shooting.

item.title: Terrorist Attack Targets Jews at Sydney’s Bondi Beach, Killing 15
item.description: The suspects are a father, also killed, and his son, in the shooting at a Hanukkah event.

item.title: Charles III Gives ‘Good News’ on Cancer Treatment
item.description: The British monarch, who was diagnosed last year, said his treatment is due to be scaled back in 2026.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: U.K. Economy Contracts Again, Likely Cementing BOE Rate Cut
item.description: Economic activity dipped 0.1% on month in October. Economists polled by The Wall Street Journal had expected an increase.
item.dc:creator: Don Nico Forbes

item.title: Britain Asked a Power Plant to Build a ‘Fish Disco.’ It’s Not Going Well.
item.description: Plans to use a deep-sea boom box to keep fish away from a coastal nuclear station have gone awry. DJing for marine life, it turns out, is a nightmare.
item.dc:creator: Eliot Brown

item.title: Crumbling Peace Deals Show Limits of Trump’s Approach to Ending Wars
item.description: The president has claimed credit for ending wars in Congo and at the Thai-Cambodian border, but fighting continues.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: 100 Nigerian Students Freed After Kidnapping at Catholic School
item.description: The Nigerian government said 100 of the students abducted from a Catholic school just over two weeks ago have been freed.

item.title: Trump-Brokered Cease-Fire Crumbles on Thai-Cambodian Border
item.description: The Thai army said it launched airstrikes in response to earlier fire from the Cambodian side.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: ‘India’ and ‘Let My Country Awake’ Review: History at an Audacious Scale
item.description: Audrey Truschke’s single-volume work makes a bold attempt to capture thousands of years of cultural ferment on the Indian subcontinent.

item.title: U.A.E.’s Ransom Payment for Kidnapped Prince Bolsters al Qaeda in Mali
item.description: Jihadists received millions of dollars as they blockade the country’s capital and security across the region deteriorates.

item.title: Russia and India’s Complicated Relationship Hinges on Oil
item.description: The two countries’ reliance on each other in the energy sector is coming under strain.

item.title: Putin and Modi Deepen Relationship That Has Drawn Trump’s Anger
item.description: The Russian president is embarking on a high-profile visit to India, aiming to protect a partnership that is a crucial for Moscow.

item.title: Pakistan Points Finger at India Over Suicide Blast
item.description: The accusation came as India’s prime minister vowed to find the perpetrators of a separate deadly explosion on Monday.

item.title: Car Explosion in India’s Capital Kills Eight
item.description: Indian officials said it was too early to say if the blast was the result of a bomb.

item.title: Trump Signals Support for Selling Submarines to Australia
item.description: The president’s comments calmed fears that he would pull out of the Biden-era deal and came as he struck an agreement with the U.S. ally on rare earths.

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.

item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
